questions.questionText: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets and is used to style web pages.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to change the background color of an element?
questions.explanation: The background-color property is used to set the background color of an element.

questions.questionText: How do you select an element with the ID 'header'?
questions.explanation: In CSS, IDs are selected using the '#' symbol.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to change the font of an element?
questions.explanation: The font-family property specifies the font for text.

questions.questionText: What is the default position value in CSS?
questions.explanation: The default position value for elements in CSS is static.

questions.questionText: How do you make text bold in CSS?
questions.explanation: The font-weight property with the value 'bold' makes text bold.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to control the space between lines of text?
questions.explanation: The line-height property controls the space between lines of text.

questions.questionText: How do you apply a style to all elements of a specific class?
questions.explanation: Classes are selected using a dot (.) followed by the class name.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to add or modify shadows for text?
questions.explanation: The text-shadow property adds or modifies shadows for text.

questions.questionText: How do you specify the width of a border in CSS?
questions.explanation: The border-width property is used to specify the width of a border.

questions.questionText: Which CSS property is used to change the text color of an element?
questions.explanation: The color property is used to set the text color of an element.

questions.questionText: Which value of the position property will make an element fixed on the screen?
questions.explanation: The fixed value positions an element relative to the browser window and does not move when scrolling.

questions.questionText: What is the use of the z-index property in CSS?
options: To control the stack order of elements
To set the opacity of an element
To change the position of an element
questions.correctOption: To control the stack order of elements
questions.explanation: The z-index property specifies the stack order of elements.

questions.questionText: How do you make an element transparent in CSS?
questions.explanation: The opacity property sets the transparency level of an element.

questions.questionText: What does the 'em' unit represent in CSS?
options: The width of the parent element
The height of the parent element
The font size of the parent element
questions.correctOption: The font size of the parent element
questions.explanation: The 'em' unit is relative to the font size of the parent element.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to create space inside an element, between its content and border?
questions.explanation: Padding creates space between the content of an element and its border.

questions.questionText: How can you apply a style to only the first child of an element?
questions.explanation: The :first-child pseudo-class targets the first child of an element.

questions.questionText: What is the function of the transition property in CSS?
options: To define the speed of animations
To create smooth changes between property values
To specify the timing of an animation
questions.correctOption: To create smooth changes between property values
questions.explanation: The transition property defines how changes in property values occur over time.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to control the horizontal alignment of text?
questions.explanation: The text-align property is used to set the horizontal alignment of text.

questions.questionText: Which property is used to make a website responsive?
questions.explanation: Responsive design is achieved using media queries, flexbox, and grid layout.
